author: By     Therese Poletti
title: EBay on its own becomes a value stock
text:
EBay is officially becoming a value play.
As the e-commerce pioneer heads into its spin-out with PayPal, with the companies beginning to trade separately on Monday, growth investors are likely to jump to the PayPal camp. But investors looking for an undervalued stock may want to head the other way.
EBay EBAY, +3.39% gave a slight uptick in its revenue forecast for fiscal 2015, raising the lower-end of its guidance to 3% from flat-growth previously. The upper-level of the guidance calls for sales growth of up to 5%, adjusted for currency fluctuations.
Shares of eBay were up 3.5% to $65.72 Thursday morning. They have risen more than 15% over the last three months, outperforming the broader S&P 500, up 0.8%.
“We are doing everything we said we would do in the first half,” eBay’s incoming Chief Executive Devin Wenig told investors Thursday on a conference call dedicated to the results and impending spin-out. “We are feeling good about where we are, we are on the right path.”
In its last quarter as a combined company with PayPal, eBay reported better-than-expected earnings and found a buyer for its enterprise business, reaping $925 million. The sale of its corporate business will enable eBay to focus on its core customer base of small- to medium-sized sellers, as well as perform a $1 billion stock buy-back.
On the call, investors asked Wenig for an update on eBay’s plan to move its product listings to a more structured database, which would enable listings to be found easier by search engines. EBay has not yet fully recovered from changes Google Inc. GOOGL, +3.05% made to its search engine algorithm that gave short shrift to eBay product listings.

Wenig said that the work has just begun.
“It’s really early,” he said, adding that eBay has 800 million items for sale. “This will take a long time.”
But if eBay can drive more traffic to its site again, and bring back its core customers, some of whom have yet to return, the dot-com era survivor could see another resurgence on Wall Street.
Just as consumers can score a great collectible for a low price on eBay, patient investors may ultimately find a real value in eBay Inc. However, it’s clear after the company’s update on Thursday that patience will be needed.
